intro: Circaea nemoralis, commonly known as the wood sorrel, is a flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in woodland environments and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common indicator species for rich, acidic soils.
